p.s: During the whole book narrative perspective switch around between the four main characters, Delaney, Kyro, Cándido and Ámerica.
The given excerpt is out of Delaney's perspective, which is why we learn a lot about his train of thought and in regard to that how he behaves.
The reader learns that Delaney is worked by a lot of prejudice against Mexicans.
The whole book is narrated in the 3rd person so we cannot exactly see in every detail what the persons think.
In this passage there is a lot of report of tohught used (l. 60, 17).
This shows us waht comes across his mind, which in this passage has mostly to do with his thoughts about Mexicans.
For example (l. 17) where the first thing he recognizes about the man is that he is Mexican.
In regard to that Delaney is building his oppinionopinion about him (l. 39).
Furthermore a lot of direct speech is used aswell (l. 27).
This also shows us the effects of DelaneysDelaney's prejudice as he is very impatient in the way he talks and also really harsh (l. 50).
He clearly does not respect him but also the Mexican does not respect him either (l. 58).
Adding to that there is a clear symbolism in this whole excerpt.
It stands for the general relationship between Americans and Mexicans.
Americans often see all Mexicans as bad, because of prejudice and stereotypes.
Delaney is an example that standstands for the typical American view of a Mexican.
But Delaney doesn't only have prejudice, he also reflects on the way he acts and also knows that he sometimes is wrong and that he is marked by a lot of stereotypes of Mexicans (ll. 60f).
In conclusion we can say that out of the readers' perception.
Delaney seems like a racist white guy, but at the same time as someone, who is fighting the urge to not let prejudice and stereotypes affect the way he behaves.
